Lack of credible sources: The expert noted that the meme did not provide any sources or references to support its claim of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security finding 12 million-plus uncounted votes for Donald Trump. This lack of credible sources raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
No disclosure from the Department of Hom: The expert mentioned that they were unable to locate any DHS material that disclosed the department's discovery of 12 million uncounted votes. Additionally, their query to the DHS press team did not receive a response. The absence of any official disclosure from the DHS casts further doubt on the claim.
Disbanding of the voter: fraud commission: The expert highlighted that President Trump had created a commission to investigate voter fraud but disbanded it after finding no evidence of large-scale voter fraud. This suggests that even the administration did not find any support for the claim of 12 million uncounted votes.
Lack of media reporting: Despite the significant nature of the claim, the expert noted that no news reporting had emerged regarding the finding of 12 million-plus uncounted votes for Trump. This absence of media coverage further undermines the credibility of the claim.
